smell_analysis.justification: All pages in the PDF contain non-empty diagrams with visible elements.
All use cases in the diagrams (Pages 2 and 3) are associated with actors, either directly or via <<include>> relationships to use cases that are connected to actors.
Use cases associated with the same actor describe distinct activities (e.g., 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid' vs 'Vaata kõiki autosid'). No redundant names found.
No distinct model elements with the same name were found within the same package on any single diagram.

Tables are normalized. Foreign keys are used correctly (e.g., 'riik_kood'), and descriptive columns (e.g., 'nimetus') appearing in multiple tables are distinct attributes for those specific entities, not redundant data copies.
Use case naming is consistent, using the 'Verb + Noun' form in Estonian (e.g., 'Registreeri auto', 'Vaata kõiki autosid').
In the State Diagram (Page 9), all states ('Ootel', 'Aktiivne', etc.) are reachable from the 'Algus' start node.
In the Activity Diagram (Page 4), all actions are reachable through the decision flows.
Relationships on class and data diagrams (e.g., Pages 5, 6, 17) include multiplicity indicators (e.g., '1', '0..*') where applicable.
No diagram exceeds the limit of 10 central elements. The most populated diagram (Page 15) contains 9 tables.
No single class or table has 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram. The maximum observed is 4 connections (e.g., 'Auto' table on Page 17).
The layout of diagrams is uniform, with related elements placed reasonably close together.
All Use Cases and Activity Actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata' (View), 'Otsi' (Search), 'Lõpeta' (Finish)).
All class, table, and attribute names exceed 3 characters (e.g., 'Isik', 'Riik', 'kood', 'auto_kood').
Class names start with uppercase letters and are singular (e.g., 'Auto', 'Isik', 'Töötaja').
Attribute and column names start with lowercase letters (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'mudel').
No type prefixes (e.g., 'tbl_', 'str') were found in element names. Standard key prefixes ('PK_', 'FK_') are allowed by the rule.
